1.text: Paul and Timotheus, servants of Jesus Christ, to all the holy in Christ Jesus at Philippi, with the overseers and servants:

2.text: Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.

3.text: I return thanks to my God for all your remembrance,

4.text: Always in all my prayer for you all with joy making prayer,

5.text: For your mutual participation in the good news from the first day until now;

6.text: Confident of this same, that he having begun a good work in you will complete till the day of Jesus Christ:

7.text: As it is just for me to think this concerning you all, for my having you in the heart; both in my bonds, and in the justification and confirmation of the good news, ye all being partakers of grace with me.

8.text: For God is my witness, how I long for you all in the bowels of Jesus Christ.

9.text: And this I prey, that your love may abound yet more and more in knowledge and all intelligence;

10.text: For you to try things differing; that ye may be pure and not stumbling to the day of Christ;

11.text: Filled with the fruits of justice, by Jesus Christ, to the glory and praise of God.

12.text: And I wish you to know, brethren, that the things concerning me have rather gone to the advancement of the good news;

13.text: So that my bonds in Christ were manifest in the whole pretorium, and to all the rest;

14.text: And many of the brethren in the Lord, having trusted to my bonds, more abundantly dared to speak the word fearlessly.

15.text: And some truly by envy and strife, and some also by kindness of disposition, proclaim Christ.

16.text: Some truly of hired labor announce Christ, not purely, thinking to bring pressure upon my bonds:

17.text: And some of love, knowing that I am placed for justification of the good news:

18.text: For what? but in any manner, whether in pretence, or truth, Christ is announced; and in this I rejoice, and certainly I will rejoice.

19.text: For I know that this shall be turned to me for salvation by your prayer, and the furnishing more of the Spirit of Jesus Christ,

20.text: According to my anxious expectation, and hope, that in nothing shall I be ashamed, but in all freedom of speech, as always, and now shall Christ be Magnified in my body, whether by life, whether by death.

21.text: For me to live is Christ, and to die gain.

22.text: And if to live in the flesh, this to me the fruit of work: and whether I shall be taken away I know not.

23.text: For I am pressed together from two, having one eager desire to be loosed, and be with Christ (rather much better:)

24.text: And to tarry yet longer in the flesh is more necessary for you.

25.text: And confident in this, I know that I shall remain, and shall remain near together with you all for your advancement and joy of faith:

26.text: That your boasting may abound in Jesus Christ in me, for my coming again to you.

27.text: Only live as citizens worthy of the good news of Christ: that whether coming and seeing you, whether being absent, I shall bear the things concerning you, that ye stand in one spirit, one soul, fighting together in faith of the good news;

28.text: And terrified in nothing by them being hostile to you: which to them is truly an indication of destruction, and to you of salvation, and this from God.

29.text: For upon you was it conferred as a favor for Christ, not only to believe on him, but also to suffer for him;

30.text: Having the same struggle which ye saw in me, and now hear in me.
